intro: Codonopsis affinis, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Codonopsis affinis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
